segment.source: title: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10
segment.target: title: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10

segment.source: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10
segment.target: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: Before you can begin using virtual machines on Windows 10 you will need to enable the Hyper-V role.
segment.target: Before you can begin using virtual machines on Windows 10 you will need to enable the Hyper-V role.

segment.source: This can be done using the Windows 10 graphical user interface, PowerShell or DISM.
segment.target: This can be done using the Windows 10 graphical user interface, PowerShell or DISM.

segment.source: This documents will walk through each of these.
segment.target: This documents will walk through each of these.

segment.source: Enable Hyper-V Through the GUI
segment.target: Enable Hyper-V Through the GUI

segment.source: Right click on the Windows button and select ‘Programs and Features’.
segment.target: Right click on the Windows button and select ‘Programs and Features’.

segment.source: Select ‘Turn Windows Features on or off’.
segment.target: Select ‘Turn Windows Features on or off’.

segment.source: Select ‘Hyper-V’ and click ‘OK’.
segment.target: Select ‘Hyper-V’ and click ‘OK’.

segment.source: When the installation has completed you will be prompted to restart your computer.
segment.target: When the installation has completed you will be prompted to restart your computer.

segment.source: Enable Hyper-V with PowerShell
segment.target: Enable Hyper-V with PowerShell

segment.source: Open a PowerShell console as Administrator.
segment.target: Open a PowerShell console as Administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command:
segment.target: Enter the following command:

segment.source: ```Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName Microsoft-Hyper-V –All`
segment.target: ```Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName Microsoft-Hyper-V –All`

segment.source: When the installation has completed you will need to reboot the computer.
segment.target: When the installation has completed you will need to reboot the computer.

segment.source: Enable Hyper-V with DISM.
segment.target: Enable Hyper-V with DISM.

segment.source: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool or DISM is used to service Windows images and prepare Windows Pre installation Evironments.
segment.target: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool or DISM is used to service Windows images and prepare Windows Pre installation Evironments.

segment.source: DISM can also be used to enable Windows features in running instances of the OS.
segment.target: DISM can also be used to enable Windows features in running instances of the OS.

segment.source: To enable the Hyper-V role using DISM:
segment.target: To enable the Hyper-V role using DISM:

segment.source: Open up a PowerShell or CMD session as Administrator.
segment.target: Open up a PowerShell or CMD session as Administrator.

segment.source: Type the following command:
segment.target: Type the following command:

segment.source: Once completed you will be prompted to reboot.
segment.target: Once completed you will be prompted to reboot.

segment.target: Next Step
